Sentencas: To enhance the performance of the thermodynamic systems, reduce the pollutants emission to the environment, and decline the fuel utilization, waste heat recovery methods are in high interest.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and thermoeconomic analysis of a novel power and hydrogen cogeneration cycle based on solid SOFC

Sentencas: In this paper, a new configuration of an integrated solid oxide fuel cell and gas turbine combined with a biogas reforming cycle is presented for the cogeneration of power and hydrogen.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and thermoeconomic analysis of a novel power and hydrogen cogeneration cycle based on solid SOFC

Sentencas: The thermal energy discharged from the SOFC-GT system is used to supply the energy required for the reforming reaction in the biogas reforming cycle for hydrogen production.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and thermoeconomic analysis of a novel power and hydrogen cogeneration cycle based on solid SOFC

Sentencas: Comprehensive thermodynamic and thermoeconomic modeling has been performed using EES software.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and thermoeconomic analysis of a novel power and hydrogen cogeneration cycle based on solid SOFC

Sentencas: Also, a parametric study has been performed to demonstrate the effect of different parameters on the main performance metrics of the devised system.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and thermoeconomic analysis of a novel power and hydrogen cogeneration cycle based on solid SOFC

Sentencas: The results revealed that the energy efficiency and exergy efficiency of the proposed combined system have increased compared to the SOFC-GT system by 23.31% and 28.19%, respectively.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and thermoeconomic analysis of a novel power and hydrogen cogeneration cycle based on solid SOFC

Sentencas: The net output power and hydrogen production rate are obtained by 2726 kW and 0.07453 kg/s, respectively.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and thermoeconomic analysis of a novel power and hydrogen cogeneration cycle based on solid SOFC

Sentencas: From the exergy viewpoint, the afterburner causes a considerable amount of exergy destruction for the system by approximately 26% of the total exergy destruction rate.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and thermoeconomic analysis of a novel power and hydrogen cogeneration cycle based on solid SOFC

Sentencas: Besides, the sensitivity analysis revealed that by increasing the inlet temperature of the fuel cell, the cell voltage reaches a maximum value at a temperature of 679 K and then decreases.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and thermoeconomic analysis of a novel power and hydrogen cogeneration cycle based on solid SOFC

Sentencas: Moreover, the total exergy destruction rate and SUCP of the cogeneration system is calculated by 1532 kW and 9400 $/GJ, respectively.
Titulo: Thermodynamic and thermoeconomic analysis of a novel power and hydrogen cogeneration cycle based on solid SOFC
